page.title: 07The Ecology of Darenth Woods
page.content: { }Darenth Wood and Ladies Wood form a most interesting 62 acres of continuous Primary Woodland. The area has been designated a Grade 1 Site of Special Scientific Interest by the National Conservancy Council. Its conservation value lies in its variety of woodland stands that reflect the variation in the underlying soil; its insect fauna; its well-documented historical record and the presence of various archeological features. Coppicing has apparently been practised for at least 400 years. After a period of neglect a programme of coppice management has been reintroduced this year. The project aims to rejuvenate degenerating coppice stools; to promote the diversity of the ground flora and to improve the wood for breeding insects and birds.
